ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] "Add URIs" functionality in View/Edit Frontier screen
ygData.msgSnippet: Heritrix is running on Solaris, but my browser is running on Windows where my file is located.  A file upload (Browse) button would be useful in this

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] "Add URIs" functionality in View/Edit Frontier
 screen
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=234926651; y=h52aiQRtA-HQs-jv2XNie8T8yqJJ8kJCEyxL8Yf65SdFdA
X-Yahoo-Profile: mccownf

Heritrix is running on Solaris, but my browser is running on Windows 
where my file is located.  A file upload (Browse) button would be useful 
in this situation.

Thanks for the update, Gordon.

Frank


Gordon Mohr wrote:
> 
> 
> Frank McCown wrote:
>  > In Heritrix 1.9, after a crawl job has been paused, the user can click
>  > "View or Edit Frontier URIs" and be taken to a screen where they can
>  > add, view, or delete URIs. Am I right in assuming the Add URIs section
>  > allows users to add URIs directly to the frontier? What advantage
>  > would there be to doing this instead of adding the URIs as additional 
> seeds?
> 
> Seeds often have special treatment, for example by changing the
> crawl's scope -- so you might want to add URIs that are not
> treated specially.
> 
> Note that if you use the 'crawl.log style' or 'recovery journal
> style', the URIs you add can have a 'via' URI and 'hops-path',
> adding more context than a plain seed.
> 
> Also, if 'force revisit' is checked, the URIs added will be
> scheduled even if they've already been previously scheduled (and
> either fetched or waiting to be fetched). So for example a series
> of connection-errors noted in the crawl.log due to a site that was
> temporarily unresponsive can be fed back into a running crawl with
> this facility.
> 
>  > In the Add URIs section, there's a text box that is labeled "Import from
>  > file:". I created a text file and specified the path to the file
>  > (C:\temp\urls.txt), but when I clicked on "Import URIs", it generated an
>  > error:
>  >
>  > Failed to get inputstream from C:\temp\urls.txt
>  >
>  > and a SEVERE alert. Is there something else that I should be typing in
>  > this box?
> 
> A path is correct. Perhaps you need to use backslashes on Windows?
> (I'm also not sure of the proper drive-based path syntax on
> Windows.) You could also try using a relative path -- I believe
> the HERITRIX_HOME directory would be the base to consider.
> 
>  > There's no Browse button, so that makes me think that it
>  > really isn't expecting an actual file path here.
> 
> A 'Browse' button wouldonly appear for a file-upload option,
> requesting a local path to upload to the crawler. This option
> instead grabs a file from local to the crawler. A file-upload
> option would be a nice addition.
> 
>  > There's also no "?"
>  > link which would tell the field is for.
> 
>  > I tried looking for some info about the Add URIs section in the User
>  > Manual but couldn't find anything.
> 
> It is poorly-documented. I've made an issue:
> 
> "View/Edit Frontier > Add URIs poorly documented"
> https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1533347&group_id=73833&atid=539099 
> <https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1533347&group_id=73833&atid=539099>
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
>
